name: agnosticism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the beliefs of someone who does not know, or believes that it is impossible to know, if a god exists: According to census figures, men significantly outnumber women in claiming agnosticism. My agnosticism is easily explainable: I can't prove that God exists, and I can't prove that God does not exist.
the fact that someone does not know or does not have an opinion about whether something is true, good, correct, etc.: They fear that the president's agnosticism about HIV will hamper his country's efforts to fight the epidemic. Is there really enough remaining doubt about global warming to justify agnosticism? Related word
agnostic
More examplesFewer examplesHe was moved to question his own agnosticism.You may think that agnosticism rejects all beliefs, but the opposite is the case.The president has described her agnosticism as a justifiable desire to ask questions.Some would see his agnosticism as the only true basis for religious faith.There seemed to be a kind of scepticism or agnosticism about human rights that I found horrifying.
